ARABIC: مَّا يَلْفِظُ مِن قَوْلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيْهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He does not utter a single word, without a watcher by him, pen in hand!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: There is not a word he utters but an observer is ready (to make note of it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He utters not a word, but there is a vigilant watcher at hand.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The human being will certainly experience the agony of death
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He does not utter a single word, without a ready recorder seated next to him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Not a word does he (or she) utter but there is a watcher by him ready (to record it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He utters not a word but there is by him a watcher at hand.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: not a word he utters, but by him is an observer ready.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He uttereth no word but there is with him an observer ready.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: each word he utters shall be noted down by a vigilant guardian.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Not a word he uttereth but there is with him a watcher ready.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: he says no word but that there is a ready observer beside him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Not a word does he utter but there is a sentinel by him, ready (to note it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Not a word does he (or she) utter, but there is a watcher by him ready (to record it).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: whatever phrase he utters, an observer is present.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Not a word does he utter, but there is a watcher by him, ready.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Man does not utter any word except that with him is an observer prepared [to record].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [50:18] he does not utter a word but that there is beside him a watcher, a guardian, [who is] ready, present (both [raqībun, ‘watcher’, and ‘atīdun, ‘ready’] are meant to indicate the dual).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He uttereth no word) the slave utters no good or evil word (but there is with him an observer ready) to record either that which is in his advantage or disadvantage.
